⠀
These little shoots are very hardy, able to withstand the winter months and germinate at low temperatures ❄️ Not many know that they're also edible - great in a pesto, wilted or fresh in a leafy salad! ⠀
⠀

node.text:
Giving a quick pause on pest posts to show how well these plants are doing. They are strong, healthy, and barely attract pests. Inside the pot I buried bokashi scraps in soil and waited for 2 weeks to transplant seedlings.

If you are planning to do the same, here are some tips from my own experience:

🌱 Add leca balls and sand at the bottom of the pot before adding the potting soil to improve drainage and avoiding leashing of scraps

🌱 Mix well the bokashi scraps with potting soil

🌱 Add a very thick layer of potting soil at the top (at least 10 cm)

🌱 Cover the pot with fabric for 2 weeks

🌱 If after two weeks you see some white mold at the top, simply remove it before adding your seedling

🌱 Sometimes the volume of the bokashi shrinks, so consider adding more soil if necessary

🌱 As the pot is usually quite big, water seedlings shallowly to avoid smelly water draining at the bottom of the pot

🌱 With time, as plants grow and scraps disappear, you can water more deeply. The smell will subside.

Have you ever used soil buried with bokashi before to plant?

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Helping you grow your own food on November 27, 2020 tagging @thegreencollective.sg, and @foodcitizensg. Image may contain: plant, text that says 'Bokashi Buried Soil Seedlings transferred 2 weeks after burying scraps'.

Good Friday! 

We are still going strong.  The peppers. The farm. 

What am I doing on Black Friday? I'm admiring the black tinge on my jalapeño peppers. 

I'm not buying a thing today LOL. 

With my garden and everything coming from it, I feel I have enough in my life.

What makes you feel abundantly blessed?

node.text:
Master the art of cooking using seasonal ingredients with Ceri!👩🏼‍🍳🥘🥦🎃⠀
⠀
Just a little Friday shoutout to let you know that our newsletter and recipe website editor @cerijoneschef is still running weekly interactive small group cooking class on zoom on Wednesday evenings.⠀
⠀
Ceri trained as a chef, but now mostly works as a food educator 👩‍🏫⠀
All of her recipes are based on seasonal ingredients (many inspired by what's in the Lee Greens bags each week 🌽🍠🥬🍅🍎🍊), and are a fun way of learning new kitchen skills as well as producing yourself a beautiful dinner.⠀
⠀
Check out Ceri's website for details of classes coming up in December and January, see link in bio.⠀
⠀

node.text:
Forest edge farmers in the Eburu #ecosystem enjoy fertile soils and good rainfall. They have the potential to earn good livelihoods by adopting best farming practices. Rhino Ark continues to support farmers to gain new skills in order to apply the #BestPractices relevant to their situations.

#RhinoArk facilitated training covering #OrganicFarming, water harvesting and dairy farming. #WaterHarvesting, including the use of dam liners, is particularly key as despite good rainfall, the area lacks surface water due to the porous nature of the volcanic soils.

The practical training was carried out at a farm Morgen area of #Eburru location done by 3 specialists, one from the Ministry of Agriculture and 2 from the private sector. 19 farmers, among them Eburu #ConservationChampions, participated fully in the training, learnt new skills and established valuable contacts. 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Rhino Ark is concerned with the holistic approach in the conservation of mountain forest ecosystems that comprise Kenya water towers.

To learn more, visit our website www.rhinoark.org, or email us at info@rhinoark.or.ke, or call +254 (0) 2136010/11 or +254 733 632 460 or +254 724 604233

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

#farmingforthefuture #agriculturenews #agriculturaleducation #agricultureeducation #sustainableagriculture #trainingpartner #smallscalefarming #farmingislife
 #RhinoArkConservation #conservation #HumansInHarmonyWithNature #habitat #ecosystem #saveourenvironment #saveourforests #environmental #biodiversity

node.text:
My name is Divya Sarin, and I am one of the co-founders of Maison Verte.🍃

We started Maison Verte because we are passionate about solving problems related to food systems and food security. One of the ways we do this is by trying to improve food accessibility through our projects. We work on many different types of projects including hosting interactive workshops, building tools, writing thought pieces, sharing content, interviewing and connecting peers within food systems, building greenhouses and designing sustainable growth plans. Our work is defined by our three pillars: Education, Community and Research. My goal is to change the way we think about sustainable food systems and make it fun and exciting! 

To learn more about our work or about me - ask away! 🌱

#kwawesome #ecofriend #grownwithlove #gardenblog #microgreens #happygardeninglife #smallscalefarming #urbanfarmer #femaleentrepreneur #sustainability #ama

node.text:
Thank you for supporting local this Christmas. By choosing to buy your free range, slow grown turkey and trimmings from us this Christmas you are supporting a number of family farms and small businesses who are working hard to produce good food sustainably and with care. You are also helping artisan skills and traditional values in food production to continue to thrive. It's not just us that you are backing but also @pittormiefruitfarm @puddledub.co.uk @cheeserydundee @balmakewanfarm @grewarsfarmshop @yourpiecebakingcompany and Silla Keyser Cakes.

node.text:
Mind blown: 1 year ago we were on top of this lil mound outside Kimberly and talking about how much we loved the area of the East Kootenays. Ambrose was a nugget in a womb and Grand Trunk Veggies had just wrapped up its best season to date. (Oh, and someone else took this photo, a real taboo these days.) Now, we are moving to the East Kootenays and starting our dream of a larger, more ecologically focused farm. Ambrose isn't a lil womb nugget, but a full blown boy-of-mischief. How things change.
.
Lots of love to everyone out there. Stay safe and healthy out there.
.
.
.
#smallscalefarming #grandtrunkveggies #grandtrunkveg #yycliving #kimberly #eastkootenays #november #lastyear #yyclife #yycsmallbusiness #yycbusiness #newfarm #startafarm #ecologicalfarming

node.text:
Spot the difference... These two fields are 2 miles apart, yet couldn't look less alike. ⠀
⠀
Photo 1 is a clay field at Maple Farm. We grew beans here last summer, and today a cover crop thrives. The diversity in this field will feed the billions of microorganisms that make our soil healthy, nutrient-rich, and fertile. In turn, our soil will be able to draw carbon dioxide out of the atmosphere. 🌱 ⠀
⠀
The field in photo 2 is no longer grazed or maintained organic as it recently was. The soil, which will still contain lots of organic matter, has been ploughed and appears waterlogged. It is now unlikely that anything will grow there this winter, so the soil life will be dormant (or worse), and its carbon content will be lost into the air in the form of harmful greenhouse gases. ⠀
⠀
It's crucial that more agriculture adopts regenerative practices to restore our soil's natural function and help to combat climate change. Plus, at Maple Farm Kelsale we know it makes our produce taste better, too 🌾⠀
⠀
#soilhealth #saveoursoil #naturalclimatesolution #covercrop #diversity #fertilesoil #soilfertility #regenerativeagriculture #conservationagriculture #conservation #organic #soilassociation #smallscalefarming #knowyourfarmer #suffolk #suffolkfarming #maplefarmkelsale

node.text:
Experience - the smallest bird of Europe/Eurasia paid a little visit😍😍😍 It was wonderful!!
This cute Goldcrest bumped against our window, nonetheless recovered soon and flew away🙏🙏
.
Hatalmas élményben volt részem. Egy szegény kis sárgafejű királyka (Regulus regulus) ütközött a teraszablakunknak. Szerencsére 12 percnyi kezemben való melegedés és lábadozás után elrepült. Annyira aranyos! Nyáron számtalanszor láttuk a kertben szorgoskodni vagy őt, vagy a szüleit, sajnáltam volna, ha elpusztul.
Itt jegyzem meg, hogy az ablakok megtévesztik a madarakat, a tükröződő ég láttán nekirepülnek, s gyakran nyakukat törik. Mi madársziluetteket ragasztottunk az ablakra, a kilátásban nem zavaró, de sok balesetet kerülünk így ki. Míg nem voltak fenn a matricák, szinte mindennapos volt a "kopogás", de hamar beszereztük a megoldást. Így is vannak ütközések, de évente pár esetnél nem több.
.

node.text:
🥬 PRODUIRE de saison pour MANGER de saison🥕
.
👨‍🌾 En ce moment il y a bien des choses à récolter au jardin potager. Nombre de légumes feuilles comme les blettes, choux kale, laitue, épinard, mâche, mizuna, choux bok-choy, tetragone, cresson, chicorée, oseille roquette... Et aussi beaucoup de légumes racines, carottes, panais, scorsonere, patate douce, chou-rave, céleri-rave, radis, topinambour...
.
📝 Oui mais qu'est ce qu'un LÉGUME FEUILLE ? C'est un légume dont la partie consommée crue ou cuite correspond aux feuilles de la plante. Côté nutritionnel, ces légumes sont faiblement caloriques, mais très riches en fibres, en fer, en calcium, en oméga-3, en protéines, en vitamines C et K ou bien encore en acide folique. Ces qualités font d'eux des aliments qui répondent particulièrement bien aux besoins nutritionnels quotidiens des humains
.
📚 Les LÉGUMES RACINES regroupent l’ensemble des légumes possédant des parties comestibles souterraines. Parfois, on les nomme « tubercules ». Ils sont reminéralisants, rassasiants et stimulent l’immunité tout en offrant un cocktail de vitamines, minéraux et oligoéléments qui nous font défaut en hiver. Côté nutrition, ils sont riches en fibres alimentaires, en potassium, calcium, magnésium, phosphore et fer. Ils contiennent aussi des vitamines B1 et C
.
➡️ Et vous, vous avez planté quoi comme légumes pour cet hiver ? 😊
. 
°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°
👨‍🌾 Johann  Permacultureaujardin
📝 Cours Online et Physique, Accompagnement Personnalisé, Création de "Design"
🌱Apprendre à produire une nourriture saine en respectant la Terre 🌍
.

Happy thanksgiving!!! 🦃

🍁 This year I am thankful for “my own dirt”. After years of volunteering on small local farms to gain farming/gardening skills and experience, just over a year ago we were able to purchase a little piece of dirt to call our own. Since then I have grown my herd from just a couple of goats to over a dozen healthy happy milk machines. 🥛 🐐 Life is good despite your best efforts 2020 😉.

📸 @hilaryhyland

Right before this year started, we met as a team in Jardín, Antioquia.🤝🏽 

💛Our experiences were filled with excitement and emotion. Some of our purposes were: 

1. To hear each other's perceptions so we could conclude that our concept of a new system was successfully proved. 🎉
2. To start a new phase as a team where we all will give life to Hilo. 🤗
3. To recognize each other's jobs in Hilo and participate in equal conditions. 🙌🏽

We are still moving with this base and the Giraldo family, and we can't wait to grow so we can participate in our system with more families. 🤩

Of course, you can be part of this, you can also join the weave!

node.text:
Cleaning Luffa/Gourds: It is important to fully air dry your luffas before peeling, removing seeds, and cleaning.  If weather and climate permits it's best if you can leave them on the vine until dry, but I dont have that luxury in zone6b.  The fruits will ruin if not fully dry before the first freeze, so I always pick them and dry indoors. Over the years I have found that hanging them to dry is the most efficient way to fully dry them.  I string them up by tying a string to the cut vine end.  It can take several weeks to fully dry.  Once dry they will sound similar to a rain stick when shaken. (See the video I posted yesterday for the sound your looking for.) To expose the luffa sponge, roll the gourd on a hard surface using pressure to break up the fibers of the skin...then peel the hard dry flesh, being careful not to fling the seeds all over.  Shake the seeds out.  This next step is optional but I find it an excellent way to remove all remaining unwanted plant fibers.  I make a solution of bleach water...about one cup of bleach to one gallon of water.  Completely submerge the sponges and let soak overnight (8-12 hours). Rince well using warm/hot water until all bleach is removed.  Let air dry and use as is or cut into smaller pieces to use in the kitchen or for personal hygiene.  Simple.
*Luffa Sponges are an easy to grow vining plant that do not take up too much space and do not have any major pest problems.  The trick with Luffas is giving the plant enough warm grow season to fully develop useful sponges.  It helps if you remove younger more underdeveloped fruits to let the plant focus its energy on forming the mature sponges.  The young fruits under 6" can be eaten like squash.  Luffa plants can get wilty in the hot afternoon sun so try to plant them where they can have a bit of protection...but still morning sun.  These plants do not like long dry spells so keep that soil moist.  Added bonus...pollinators flock to the beautiful yellow blossoms of the luffa plant all through summer and fall.
#luffaplant #luffasponge #luffa #growyourownsponge #usefulplants #plantsforpollinators #growfoodnotlawns #urbanfarming #smallscalefarming #gyo #zone6bgarden

node.text:
Happy Thanksgiving, 
from our family to yours. 
.
This year in a time when so many events and things were cancelled and changed, we have found so many blessings to be thankful for and counted.  One of the biggest blessing we, I, am thankful for this year is our amazing customers who have stuck by my small business and literally pulled us through on the financial side of things in a year when I was not sure I'd make it through. So many small businesses and restaurants are suffering. I thought, "wow, this is what the beginning to the end feels like, I'm coming into this season off last years terrible growing conditions and set backs now into a pandemic...there is no way I'm going to survive this." Farming isn't cheap or for the faint of heart. But with all of your support, and my family and friends rallying around me, I am still standing. Whether you purchased produce from my farm or shared the word with your family and friends, you helped pull us through. 
T H A N K  Y O U! 
.
This Thanksgiving looks and feels differently but the gratitude is abundant. 
Much love, kelsey
#knifeandforkfarms #knifeandforkit #kffyearfive

node.text:
🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃

We want to to wish everyone a Happy, Safe, and Delicious Thanksgiving first and foremost! 🦃

We hope everyone gets to enjoy good food and company today!

Jessica and I also want to take moment to Express how thankful we are for the greater Lewiston/Auburn community! Many of you have continually supported our efforts to provide the community with open access to fresh, nutrient dense, locally grown food which has allowed us to continually grow with the community at large! Thank you ! It means a lot to us! We are so greatful to be able to live a lifestyle of self reliance while maintaining a connection to the entire community.

Whether it's the carrots, greens and eggs we serve you at the markets, or the work I get to help on as a councilor on the GFCLA or as a Steering Commitee member for the Lewiston Farmers Market. It's an AWESOME opportunity to serve you all, and both of us are so thankful and greatful for the opportunity. 

Happy Thanksgiving Everyone!

PS - Eat & Laugh a lot! ✌😎🤗🤣

Sincerely, 

Jessica Robert's & Jesse Tannenbaum

🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃🦃

node.text:
Eure #EchtenOrangen sind gross, klein, perfekt, vernarbt, orange, grün – sie haben viele Gesichter.
Eines haben sie jedoch alle gemein. Ihre Kisten sind ausgezeichnet mit «zur Verarbeitung bestimmt» – Diese Kennzeichnung ermöglicht uns per Gesetz, Früchte aller Formen und Farben zu verkaufen. Sinnlose Standards der Lebensmittelindustrie spielen keine Rolle. #NatureIsQueen Wir freuen uns über alle Fotoeinsendungen unter dem Hashtag #EchteOrangen oder via Email an video@gebana.com. Herzlichen Dank an alle Einsender! 
══════════════
Your #RealOranges come in full variety – they are big, small, perfect, scarred, orange, green. However, there is one thing they all have in common: Their shipping boxes are labeled with «For processing only». This label enables us to legally export fruit in all its diversity. Useless standards such as predefined size and color are not relevant. #NatureIsQueen. We look forward to receiving images of your #RealOranges using the hashtag #RealOranges or via email to video@gebana.com
________________________________
#WeltweitAbHof #gebana #PioneerOfChange #EchteOrangen #JedeOrangeZählt #gebanaSeason #FairerHandel #bewusstleben #ökologisch #mehralsbio #mehralsfair #beyondfairtrade #beyondorganic #choosefairtrade #ethicalcompany #organicproduce #freshharvest #smallscalefarming #naturefirst #lolcalproduce #eatseasonal #gemeinsambewegen #gemeinsamverändern #activechange #greekproduce #fairtradefoods

node.text:
This tractor is for sale! Know anyone who has a tractor on their Christmas list? 😉 I can deliver in Grey Highlands area or Stratford/KW/Guelph area. 🚚

It's a Massey Ferguson 135 with Perkin's diesel engine. Engine is in good shape. Transmission has been partially rebuilt. New tires all around. New radiator. I used it for many years at @silvercreeknursery but not needed any more. 3 point hitch and pto. Works really well on a bush hog or snow blower. Hour meter is not working. I think it's a 1973 model. Asking $5900. A great multi purpose tractor for small scale farming/homesteading!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Marion Ann Berry in Durham Bridge, New Brunswick. Image may contain: plant and outdoor.

node.text:
One of my favourite spots on the farm to look out on. Looking out over the #nodig beds that I've created the last two years. From here I can see the chickens, the polytunnels, my compost heaps and water catchment systems, a little further and the beginings of a food forest, the structures I've built, outdoor kitchen and rocket stove shed. All the things I've dreamt of for the past decade.
.
Buy my vision doesn't stop there, I can see the space growing, in yields and biodiversity, in potential and relevance, for ourselves and future generations.
.
To farm our own food is one thing, but to become so intrinsically linked to the land that you depend on it more so than the convenience of shops and capatilism is somewhat of step up. Daily rituals that are more than just chores borne from necessity, like that of gathering wood or heating water, they also become our exercise, our meditations, our freedoms.
.
A life of convenience is easy, hot water on tap, light at the flick of a switch, microwave pizza stored in the freezer... But at what cost? 9-5 working hours, 30+ years paying a mortgage? No thanks, I'd sooner spend my day harvesting and storing sunlight, in its glorious and plentiful forms.
.
.
.
#polytunnel #permaculture #marketgarden #marketgardening #provenance #abundance #seasonal #produceayield #igrewthis #mygardentoday #gogreen #smallholding #homestead #homesteading #urbanfarming #organicgardening #homegrown #growwhatyoueat #eatwhatyougrow #letfoodbethymedicine #jardin #greenspace #regenerativeagriculture #smallscalefarming #communitysupportedagriculture #slowlife #slowliving #selfsufficient #frost

node.text:
After building 31 rows with a wheelbarrow, I have decided its time for this relationship to end. Yes that's right, wheelbarrow and I never want to see each other again, we're done!!! 😆 
Its time to bring in the big guns and get these beds finished once and for all. We did seven rows yesterday which means six more to go in two weeks from now. Time to get planting ;) Also been saving some seed which is quite fun. Chinese Cabbage, Bok Choy and Cress.
.
.

node.text:
This is our first time growing garlic and we're learning a lot. The scapes look quite beautiful on the plant and last night we discovered that that they make a delicious and simple side dish sautéed whole. Now we're waiting to see if garlic flattened by wind will stand back up 🤞 (They're mostly still standing so it's not a disaster thankfully!) 
.
.
.
#garlic #smallscalefarming #knowyourproduce #sprayfree #eatlocal

node.text:
Black Cohosh Roots (Actaea racemosa)

Hello Friends!

I am in the process of transitioning this to a personal/private account. 

BUT, there are some pretty exciting things happening on the farm right now! 

One being establishing our first "at risk" Medicinal understory gardens amongst our deciduous hard wood maple grove. 

If you wish to continue to follow us and our growing story at the Wild Folk Herb Farm we would love to see you over @wildfolkherbfarm

In Heart
Störii
www.wildfolkherbfarm.com

#plantmedicine #herbalist #smallscalefarming #atriskplants #blackcohoshroot #microfarming  #womenwhofarm #rootmedicine #ancestralmedicine #goldensealroot #understorygarden

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Störii Wild on November 25, 2020 tagging @wildfolkherbfarm. Image may contain: 1 person, standing, hat and outdoor.

node.text:
C’est lancé!
Allez découvrir les nouvelles couleurs ainsi que les nouveaux produits sur la boutique en ligne (lien en bio).
Les tabliers sont déjà populaires chez les restaurateurs, j’ai donc décidé de vous offrir leur modèle préféré en « prêt-à-porter ».
La matière a été choisis avec soin, un canevas de qualité supérieur pour que votre produit vous suive encore plusieurs saisons. 
Bien heureuse de vous offrir cette nouvelle sélection encore plus durable.
.
Merci à ma complice @mai_images pour le magnifique rendue des produits, même quand je sais pas trop où je m’en vais.
.
N’hésitez pas à partager si ça vous plait!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Caravel on November 19, 2020. Image may contain: people standing and indoor.

node.text:
C’est important de comprendre la différence que ça fait d’acheter chez des petits producteurs, des designers passionnés, des artisans minutieux, pour offrir à ceux qu’on aime.
L’objet porte une belle intention qui prend vie dans l’utilisation que son propriétaire en fait, il devient précieux.
Chaque achat est un acte de décision de valeurs. 
Je suis vraiment pas parfaite de ce côté, mais c’est important d’en prendre conscience. Prendre conscience de notre pouvoir d’achat décisionnel.
.
Pour les fêtes, mes produits sont disponibles sur la nouvelle plateforme virtuel du @soukmtl
Le porte-outil est disponible en couleurs exclusifs, je vous laisses découvrir!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Caravel in Vieux Terrebonne with @mai_images.

node.text:
How come Plant foods are just SO BEAUTIFUL?! I just adore them. 100% want to bring those into my body and let them become me ;)
(ok that sounded a little weird but you know what i mean ..!) 😆
.
Gorge produce this week from @nourishedcommunities – who, if you are local to #Islington, #London you’re lucky – these lovely peeps’ well-stocked popup shop open days are steadily increasing (think farm #marketstall + whole food shop + #zerowasteshop combined!)
.
I just love seeing small, passionate initiatives like these take foot and steadily grow stronger as people around them understand just how lucky they are to get access to this kind of produce. And just how much small businesses like these bring to a local area 👊 #shoplocalforthewin #londonlockdown2
.
Much love, Sara x
#shisodelicious

node.text:
This week we are happy to share with you @sullifarmandkitchen 👩‍🌾 They strive to build community around food, to have relationships with the families that consume their product.  They want you to know where your food comes from, how it was produced, how it affects you, and how it affects the environment around you. 💛

@farmstandrevival’s NEWEST Featured Farm: 👍 @sullifarmandkitchen

“Here at Sullifarm, we embrace a rather full-circle scene in agriculture.  One that’s all about restoration, repair, healing and health.  We don’t just grow food, we strive to regenerate our soils and pastures in the process. 
.
Pasture-raising animals according to their natures thus creating the tastiest and healthiest food products in a local and regenerative farm setting.”

Hooks, TX
📸: @sullifarmandkitchen
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Join the movement! 👩‍🌾 👍 Let’s Revive Small Local Farms 🙌🏻 We feature small regenerative growers 👩‍🌾 👨‍🌾 from around the world! 🥕

Support Us by checkin’ out our SMALL-SCALE FARMING APPAREL! 🤩💚 Link in bio --> @farmstandrevival *1 % Of Profits Donated Tp Supporting Small Farms!

node.text: We have been so busy getting the farm ready for winter but I’m happy to say we got the new greenhouse up and running right before the first snowfall of the season. It’s not perfect but I’m proud of how it came out and happy to have more space for our #microgreens 🌱Building a greenhouse from scratch was the easy part, growing in Tahoe during the winter will be the challenging part. 🌱🌱🌱 #HighAltitudeFarming
